messages: 2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (08:34): 0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17: were you trolling github tables?

2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (08:38): in getting the data I wanted
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (08:38): | sort(field="blah")
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (08:39): tack that onto the yql query?
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (08:39): at the end like in bash, yeah
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (08:39): i'm not the best with this topic yet, but working on the fact
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (08:40): you can also PM me, if you want, the rest of this room might not care about YQL tips (though it super cool!)

0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (08:40): right now i simply have it pulling in all my repos and it orders from first to last, i wonder if i could get it to float the most recently updated ones to the top
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (08:42): 0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17: what are you trying to do?
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (08:42): hmm, looks like pushed-at would be the best way to order by
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (08:42): pull my repos into my resume site
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (08:42): 0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17: like this -> http:/ 2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780.org/#!projects ?
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (08:42): just for a basic list
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (08:42): http://michaelbeckwithsresume.com
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (08:43): click interests to get to it quick
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (08:43): Github Repositories?
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (08:44): right now, it goes in order i created, oldest at the top
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (08:44): if i can figure out how, i'd like the most recently pushed at the top
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (08:45): want a pastebin of what i have for php?
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (08:47): pastebin.com/X4dQBx27
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (08:52): no huge deal if i don't figure this out tonight :D i'm glad i got this far really

2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (08:52): 0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17: select repository.pushed-at.content, repository.url, repository.name, repository.description from github.user.repos where id='spullara'
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (08:52): 0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17: close, but YQL is being a c***
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (08:52): it's giving me errors in FF4
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (08:53): but i appreciate it :D

2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (08:55): select repository.pushed-at, repository.url, repository.name, repository.description from github.user.repos where id='spullara' and repository.pushed-at != '' | sort(field="repository.pushed-at", descending="true")
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (08:56): http://yhoo.it/ft7CnD
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (08:57): grab the REST query from that and stick it in your PHP file
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (08:57): you also might have to update your PHP's handling of XML/JSON a touch
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (08:58): you also seem to want forks, so add that to the field list
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (08:58): as you can tell, i'm not against working on a live site
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (08:58): not that i get a lot of traffic yet
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (08:58): stay buggy, my friend

0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (09:01): back to work i go! zoom zoom

2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (09:02): 0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17: also, small note - if you only need a couple of these repos (not all 28), you can put a remote limit that speeds up your query a bit by putting (0, N) after the table name
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (09:03): like this - http://yhoo.it/eEnKB8
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (09:04): whatever, like this - from github.user.repos (0, 3) <--
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (09:05): my goal is to never ship anything I don't need across the wire in YQL
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (09:05): otherwise it's a bit of a waste
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (09:06): what i need most is more ideas on ways to experiment with the topic so i can work on my filtering etc
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (09:06): instead of select *
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (09:06): and sometimes, you just need a useless idea to tackle
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (09:11): there are tons of things you can do with YQL
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (09:14): not saying there isn't, what i'm saying is a good idea that you can plan out
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (09:14): just for the hell of it
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (09:14): find a good practice goal and make your way to it
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (09:20): 2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 i think i have it just as i want now, thanks for the help :)
